column5: Sorry bud, Madison, WI already has the market cornered on the "pink flamingi" - since they first started flocking to Bascom Hill in 1979.Each year a flock of 1,008+/- magically appear overnight and rest their weary bones for a week on the UW-Madison campus' administrative building lawn.They are the "Official City Bird" of Madison, the backup Badgers mascot (to Bucky), & are so friendly they will eat out of your hand.It is believed that global warming is responsible for their northerly migration each year, which - as you can clearly see - is already in a run-away state.
Great report.lovè it
They taste pretty good if you boil them for 4 hours in salt water. Then let them sit and a bucket of Windsor for 3.5 days. Strain everything in a strainer and then drink the Windsor

Ahhhhhhhhhh...........another group of kindred spirits who  might be  about a full bubble off center most of the time. Ya got to love the effort!!!!!! It has to be hard to get them all to line up properly. I mean, it has to be like, well, like herding flamingos....... PjShorthorn
That makes me sad. PjShorthorn
Maybe next year with better conditions.
Getting them to wear masks might be a issue.
Mandatory ònly indoors.So might work out for them.
UPDATE I have not seen the video but according to neighborhood security cameras this flock did indeed head north!! Later, Jay
Where are THEY going to quarantine for 14 days .........
I have a cabin on LOW, they can stay there if need be !! ****, my wife and I didn't get to this year
I hear the meat is a little crunchy.
Depends on what kind of coating you use ?
Tastes just like chicken.
I don't know if these are headed north or south but they showed up in a neighbors yard. Later, Jay
Pat..........you sneak a trip to Iowa?
mixing it up in your Snows goose spread? I like it, it'll pull em from miles out

Nope...I heard that Iowa had border restrictions to make sure Georgia folk don't come to visit. I think that VBay Gord is the most likely culprit. He apparently has had an infestation of the varmits over the years and may have imported them since Canadian residents can fly into the US. Maybe the football program will change their mascot from the Hawkeyes to the Flamingos At least they would be recognized for their uniforms..... PjShorthorn
Come on now, be nice. Iowa finished #15 Nationally last year.And we haven't lost yet this year.

Golden Domer fans are right there with Nebraska fans, stuck in the past. They have been no more relevant than Iowa in quite some time. However, unlike Nebraska, the talking heads must like the looks of ND uniforms because they start out way overrated each year. Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Ouchie bro....that was a little harsh.....LOL. I didn't go to ND.....I just had to pay for the educations.....LOL. PjShorthorn
I think that this is "another thing" that we can blame on COVID...........

I have to respectfully disagree. It is strictly related to the fact that my marketing plan is starting to take root. Although I may have wanted a different brand to start with, the Flamingo has to start somewhere. It looks like Iowa is that place..... In a store near you...... PjShorthorn
Did not see any pinks up north this year pj.
